intro: Lophiaris silverarum, commonly known as the silverleaf lophiaris, is a perennial plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting well to sandy or rocky soils. Due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal, it is often cultivated in xeriscapes and rock gardens.
